page.title: 14HEALTH IN BORDON
page.content: There are ten health centres in Bordon. The Elizabeth Dibbin Health Clinic was opened in 1985 by Mrs Elizabeth Dibbin. It is the main base of the Health Visitors and District Nurses of this area. There is speech therapy, physiotherapy, a chiropody clinic, family planning and child health clinic held there. Also on Forest Road is the Forest Surgery, the Pine Hill Surgery and Woolmer Surgery. The Pine Hill Surgery and Woolmer Surgery were also opened in 1985. There are two Dental Surgeries on Chalet Hill and one in Park Street where the Community House Social Services are held. As Bordon is growing into a small town a hospital is being planned in Forest Road. For accidents Aldershot is the nearest hospital.
